title: Kate Moss and pals travelled the Orient Express for a lavish birthday
text:
Alexa, play Fancy by Iggy Azalea (Picture: Kate Moss/Instagram)

Kate Moss and her friends arrived in Venice in style via the Orient Express to celebrate James Brown’s 50th birthday.

The supermodel cat-walked down the carriage in a cream satin dress accessorised with a luxe shawl looking like she jumped right out of a ‘20s ballroom.

Kate, 45, travelled on the luxury train with her close friend and celebrity hairdresser James Brown and shared many snaps of the famous interior.

James uploaded a video of Kate and others modelling down the carriage and captioned it: ‘Oops we were trying to be glam !! Thank you for the best trip ever @katemossagency @sadielizafrost @rosemaryferguson_@davidgardner @darrenstrowger and thank you @vsoetrain for luxury beyond I can’t wait to come back’.

James and Kate were joined by pals Sadie Frost, Rosemary Ferguson, Darren Strowger and James’ hubby David Gardner.

Where were our invitations?

Advertisement

Advertisement

The Orient Express used to be a long-distance passenger train created in the late 19th century that would originally travel to and from Paris and Istanbul.

There has been a murder on the catwalk – Detective Poirot, probably (Picture: Instagram/James Brown)

Cosy queens (Picture: Instagram/sadielizafrost)

What better way to celebrate your 50th than in the Orient Express bar? (Picture: Instagram/James Brown)

Now, the Simplon Orient Express only travel around Europe and is a gorgeous place for your Instagram modelling needs.

Kate was recently seen head over heels in love with Count Nikolai von Bismark as the two hung out in London.

The couple were celebrating the launch of his new book with Dior when they were joined by their nearest and dearest.

With the glossy pages of The Dior Sessions sitting pretty on display, the likes of newly-engaged Princess Eugenie and Jack Brooksbank along with similarly freshly-betrothed sister Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mozzi also arrived at the party.

Wearing a velvet dream of a black dress, it seemed to be an all-black affair as fashion’s elite turned out in darker hues – perhaps to mask the watermarks bestowed by the horrendous London weather.

The supermodel was all smiles as she strutted into the Dior store on Bond Street hand-in-hand with photographer Nikolai, 32, who she’s been dating since 2015.

description: Kate Moss and her close friend took over the Orient Express to Venice while celebrating James Brown's 50th birthday.
